summary:
The Kingdom of Prussia was a powerful German state from 1701 to 1918. It played a key role in unifying Germany in the 19th century. Prussia's capital was Berlin, and its rulers were from the Hohenzollern family.

Frederick the Great, a famous king, made Prussia strong and led it to victory in wars, making it a major European power. Prussia tried to unite all German states, leading to conflicts and eventually the creation of the German Empire in 1871. After the German Revolution in 1918, Prussia became a free state but was later abolished in 1947.
title: Kingdom of Prussia
